history.content:
Depends on how you see it. The pace is faster during summer but less material is covered. For example continuous probability/graph theory is barely touched on during summer, while during regular semesters you get to go through the entirety of both topics above.

-----------

In the last two summers (which are what I'm personally familiar with), CS70 has skipped general error-correcting, which is about a lecture's worth of content. There are other variations in content, but comparable to the natural variation of content between different professors teaching the class. (Specifically, the last two summers have most closely followed Vazirani's version of the class.)

In general, summer classes need to cover the same material as the regular semester, because those are topics that later classes assume students to have learned.

The summer instructor, as far as I know, has not been announced yet. It will also likely be that person's first time teaching.

You should see the summer courses website about fees information.

Edit: Responding to the answer above: graph theory is covered only slightly less than Vazirani, which is still more than Sahai (who does not cover the topic), and thus part of the natural variation I was referring to. But yes, I forgot that continuous probability is also only touched on.

In the last two summers (which are what I'm personally familiar with), CS70 has skipped general error-correcting, which is about a lecture's worth of content. children.subject: I took CS 70 in the spring and had to take a NP because my learning style didn't mesh with his teaching style, but 70 in the summer was so much better for me personally. Mostly because it was all I needed to focus on, so more time made it easier for me if that makes sense.

history.content:
Is CS 70 harder or easier in the summer? I know it depends on professors but my question is whether or not they are trying to squeeze in the entire semester's course into the summer or if they cut some parts out. Also, is the professor who will be teaching it in the summer going to be easier?

Also, if I register for Summer session but later decide not to take it, when is the deadline to have no fees?
history.subject: CS 70 in the summer
